channel.title: Brand Specific Game Integrations on Aurora User Docs
channel.description: Recent content in Brand Specific Game Integrations on Aurora User Docs

item.title: Alienware LightFX
item.description: You can use Lightsync integration with all supported devices You must install LightFX wrapper dll to the game directory from Aurora settings. Note that this is reverse engineered and may not work as the original.

item.title: Brand Integrations
item.description: Some of the brand specific game integrations are reverse-engineered to work with Aurora. See their pages to see how they are configured. PCGamingWiki page about integrations

item.title: Logitech Lightsync
item.description: You can use Lightsync integration with all supported devices Note that this is reverse engineered and may not work as the original. You can have LGS installed and Aurora will automatically apply game effects to your devices. LGS must be fully closed before Aurora is launched.

item.title: Razer Chroma
item.description: You can use Chroma integration with all supported devices Note that this is reverse engineered and may not work as the original. You can have Synapse installed and Aurora will automatically apply game effects to your devices. Then, “Razer Chroma SDK Service” needs to be running for the integration to work. Chrome Enabled Games List on www.razer.com RAZER is the trademark or registered trademark of Razer Inc.
